messages.subject: RE: [Unschooling-dotcom] sugar, was re: plug-in drug
messages.msgSnippet: We don t prohibit sugar, but I think some people think honey is *better* because of its medicinal and healing properties? Here s an interesting honey website:
messages.messageBody:
We don't prohibit sugar, but I think some people think honey is
*better* because of its medicinal and healing properties?

Here's an interesting honey website:
http://www.nhb.org/research/index.html

Living Joyfully,
Lara Nabours-the *other* Lara ;)

-----Original Message-----
From: Laramike12@... [mailto:Laramike12@...]
Sent: Thursday, March 27, 2003 11:46 AM
To: Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [Unschooling-dotcom] sugar, was re: plug-in drug



In a message dated 3/27/03 3:15:20 PM, jana@... writes:

<< When kids can have free-access to a wide
variety of food, including vegetables, fruit, nuts, meats, grains
and
honey, they don't miss sugar. >>

I'm curious why sugar is prohibited. I assume it's for the obvious
reasons,
the same reasons anyone would ban or limit sugar, until I get to the
part
that honey is ok. Honey and sugar are the SAME as far as the body's
concerned. So I'm just curious if what sugar does to the body, is
the reason
why your family abstains from sugar (because if it is, then you need
to stop
eating honey too), or if it's a totally different reason (like that
it
*sounds* better that honey comes from bees, and sugar is processed
first).
BTW, my mom (too?) thought honey was somehow "better" for you than
sugar when
we were growing up, so I had mostly honey, and rarely sugar, but now
people
know there's really no difference (as far as what it does in/to your
body)
between the two. Lara..........

messages.subject: sugar, was re: plug-in drug
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 3/27/03 3:15:20 PM, jana@fig.org writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 3/27/03 3:15:20 PM, jana@... writes:

<< When kids can have free-access to a wide
variety of food, including vegetables, fruit, nuts, meats, grains and
honey, they don't miss sugar. >>

I'm curious why sugar is prohibited. I assume it's for the obvious reasons,
the same reasons anyone would ban or limit sugar, until I get to the part
that honey is ok. Honey and sugar are the SAME as far as the body's
concerned. So I'm just curious if what sugar does to the body, is the reason
why your family abstains from sugar (because if it is, then you need to stop
eating honey too), or if it's a totally different reason (like that it
*sounds* better that honey comes from bees, and sugar is processed first).
BTW, my mom (too?) thought honey was somehow "better" for you than sugar when
we were growing up, so I had mostly honey, and rarely sugar, but now people
know there's really no difference (as far as what it does in/to your body)
between the two. Lara..........
